title: xen_artist
author: xen_artist
content: which sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals related nft project?

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: Quote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals related nft project?I would put it here: Marketplace > Goods > Collectibles

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals related nft project?If it is about the project and its development,  I would put in Project development boardhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=12.0

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals related nft project?Is there a need of creating more threads upon the ones tgat have been created that talked about ordinals? Why not make it simple by using the search button and post your discussion under one of those threads and we move on, if you truly understand why it is necessary to totally fight against spamming and repeated postings already discussed, so search the forum and select a desirable thread existing under ordinals and post.

comments.author: Ryker1
comments.body: If that is the bitcoin artifacts [digital or physical] --collectibles subforum perhaps suitable to post and the post above was right if that is related to the development --Project development board is the right one.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: 348Judah on March 17, 2023, 12:32:42 PMQuote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals-related NFT projects?Is there a need of creating more threads upon the ones that have been created that talked about ordinals? Why not make it simple by using the search button and post your discussion under one of those threads and we move on, if you truly understand why it is necessary to totally fight against spamming and repeated postings already discussed, so search the forum and select a desirable thread existing under ordinals and post. I think Op is planning on creating his NFTs and therefore needs his thread but for now, he lacks the knowledge of each board and what types of posts are accepted in a certain board. I don't think op just wants to discuss ordinals but if however, it turns out that I'm wrong about op having to create his project then he should consider joining some of the already existing threads.

comments.author: xen_artist
comments.created_time: March 17, 2023, 01:34:56 PMLast edit: March 17, 2023, 05:39:31 PM by mprep
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on March 17, 2023, 01:10:09 PMQuote from: 348Judah on March 17, 2023, 12:32:42 PMQuote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals-related NFT projects?Is there a need of creating more threads upon the ones that have been created that talked about ordinals? Why not make it simple by using the search button and post your discussion under one of those threads and we move on, if you truly understand why it is necessary to totally fight against spamming and repeated postings already discussed, so search the forum and select a desirable thread existing under ordinals and post. I think Op is planning on creating his NFTs and therefore needs his thread but for now, he lacks the knowledge of each board and what types of posts are accepted in a certain board. I don't think op just wants to discuss ordinals but if however, it turns out that I'm wrong about op having to create his project then he should consider joining some of the already existing threads. yes, I am creating my own ordinals nft project and trying to find a proper board to discuss it with the right audiences.many thanks for your help.Quote from: bitmover on March 17, 2023, 11:02:43 AMQuote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals related nft project?If it is about the project and its development,  I would put in Project development boardhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=12.0many thanks for your help.[moderator's note: consecutive posts merged]

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: Ryker1 on March 17, 2023, 12:36:10 PMIf that is the bitcoin artifacts [digital or physical] --collectibles subforum perhaps suitable to post and the post above was right if that is related to the development --Project development board is the right one.As he has said NFT collection so probably it would be digital one only but if he is making some project that will have real building over it bitcoin related then project development is suitable board for it rather then collectibles board.Quote from: xen_artist on March 17, 2023, 01:49:15 PMmany thanks for your help.Try to reply in a single post as making multiple posts in a row is against the forum rules as considered as violation so try to take care of these things and read  Rules  before posting on forum that will help you a lot.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: aysg76 on March 17, 2023, 03:24:42 PMTry to reply in a single post as making multiple posts in a row is against the forum rules as considered as violation so try to take care of these things and read  Rules  before posting on forum that will help you a lot.I just reported the replies to be merged together.Some users are not aware that they can 'insert quote' while making a reply, forcing them to send and start another reply.OP when typing a reply, scroll down to previous highlighted messages and click on insert quote. This would automatically add the quote to the message you are typing.- Jay -

comments.author: AI Am I
comments.body: Quote from: xen_artist on March 16, 2023, 10:22:41 PMwhich sub-forum is suitable for posting bitcoin ordinals related nft project?If you're looking to post about a Bitcoin-related NFT project, the most appropriate sub-forum on Bitcointalk would be the "Alternate cryptocurrencies" or "Altcoins" sub-forum. These sub-forums focus on discussions about cryptocurrencies other than Bitcoin, including NFTs and other blockchain-based tokens. However, it's always a good idea to read the forum rules and guidelines before posting to ensure that your post is appropriate and follows the forum's guidelines.
